Show HN: HealthPlanExplorer.com: Search & parse insurance plan MRF Files
text:
Been exploring the Transparency in Coverage Rule (https://www.cms.gov/healthplan-price-transparency) that forces every health insurer to publish their contract rates with every provider they have in network in a machine readable format (json files)

These published files are massive (about a petabyte of data a month with individual files up to 20GB) and a PITA to dig through. We built HealthPlanExplorer.com to make it easy to search the files. You can:

- choose any in network file (as many as you want) - search by National Provider Identifier (NPI) - search by CPT Code

And we'll generate a CSV with the results. If the items you search for aren't found, we'll give you the full export. Next up, we'll make it queryable so you can do different cuts much more quickly.

title: BioGPT: A language model pre-trained on large-scale biomedical literature
Ask HN: Have we reached ChatGPT article saturation yet?
text:
Have a look at the current front page. It's been a couple days at least that ChatGPT and AI articles have filled at least 1/3rd of it.

Lisp on here is cyclical, arrives like a comet, showers us with articles about it, and leaves for months at a time. It's always a lovely sight.

We have had the Erlang days, that were so bad pg had to personally intervene.

Then there was the Bitcoin phase, and that also required a divine hand to stop it from getting out of hand.

Now it's another AI hype era, both in Computer Science and on this site. Have we reached maximum ChatGPT hype yet? For something so technologically advanced yet accessible to anyone, there awaits us a massive pile of written word on it for the foreseeable future, and personally, I have started to tune it out.
